reviewText: The Ian Wright trip to Morocco is an old favourite of mine. This updated version retains much of the original footage and the new sequences by Megan McCormick are really fascinating and well researched.
I am a real traveler - I wanted more details.  Ian is entertainment
Excellent Video for High School Geography

I purchased this as a gift for my father and he absolutely loved it!  He loves nature and traveling DVDs, but I often have trouble finding ones he does not already own or seen.  However, this one he hadn't seen and he was excited to receive this.  My sisters bought him the other DVDs that go with this one.  What a perfect gift!  The item shipped very quickly too.
Globe Trekker is always interesting. I am going to Morocco in a couple weeks and this gave me a lot of good information.

Globe Trekker is always consistant in their quality coverage of whatever area they land in and "Northern Australia" is no exception. Ian Wright explores the "outback" which is one of the most sparse and rugged landscapes on earth. Megan takes us to Queensland home of the oldest rainforest on the planet. They take us camping on the biggest sand island in the world and then, diving amongst the Great Barrier Reef`s. Who could ask for more? It`s great! Globe trekker rocks!

It's not that this DVD is bad - it is fine.  However, this DVD is included with the newer Globe Trekker - Australia (Double DVD).  So get that instead, unless you want to buy the same DVD twice - like I did.
